induct.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to officially give someone a job or position of authority, especially at a special ceremony
induct.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Eighteen new junior ministers were inducted into the government.
induct.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to officially introduce someone into an important place of honour at a special ceremony
induct.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Barry was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame in 1987.
induct.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to officially introduce someone into a group or organization, especially the army
induct.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to officially introduce someone into a new job or organization, usually through a special ceremony
induct.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Mr Clay will be inducted into the company as president at a benefit dinner on Sunday.
